# Making a bilingual website

---
##In _languages.toml_

``` code
[en]
  languageCode = "en-us"
  contentDir = "content/en"  # Uncomment for multi-lingual sites,and move English content into `en` sub-folder.
  title = "English site"
# Uncomment the lines below to configure your website in a second language.
[es]
 languageCode = "es"
 contentDir = "content/es"
  title = "Sitio en español"

  [es.params]
   description = "Sitio en español"
  [[es.menu.main]]
    name = "es"
    url = "#about"
    weight = 1
```
---
# Then

Create 2 files: **menus.es.toml** and       **menus.en.toml** 

--

In **config.toml**, we can choose the default lenguage. For example, if we want that our page in spanish _defaultContentLanguage = “es"_

--

To make visible that the webpage is bilingual, it is convenient to go to **params.toml** and verify that the _show_language=TRUE_

<img src="images/params.png" width="100%"/>

class: inverse, middle, center

# Let's deploy the website!!

---
# Hugo version

Put _**netlify.toml**_ in the project's base folder. In this file we must specify the version of Hugo used.

```{r, eval=TRUE, echo=TRUE}

blogdown::hugo_version()

```

And the _**netlify.toml**_ must be like this:

```{r, eval= FALSE, echo=TRUE}

[build.environment]
  HUGO_VERSION = "0.78.1" #Here is the hugo version
  HUGO_ENABLEGITINFO = "true"

```
